keywords.cdata: aged, AIDS epidemic, behavior change, Behaviour Change, blood safety, capacity building, civil society organizations, clinics, commercial sex, commercial sex workers, condoms, discrimination, drugs, economic growth, effective prevention, epidemiological surveillance, equipment, female sex workers, financial management, Gender, Government agencies, health facilities, health infrastructure, health management, health sector, high risk groups, high-risk groups, HIV, Hospital, infection, information system, information systems, institutional capacity, labor force, Ministry of Health, morbidity, mortality, mother, mother-to-child, mother-to-child transmission, National AIDS, National Council, new cases, new infections, NGOs, Number of persons, Nurses, older men, opportunistic infections, orphans, population groups, pregnant women, prevention efforts, prevention interventions, private sector, productivity, public health, respect, risk factors, service delivery, sex with men, sexual interactions, sexual relationships, sexually transmitted diseases, sexually transmitted infections, social factors, sub-Saharan Africa, Sustainable Development, Sustainable management, technical assistance, treatment services, Trinidad and Tobago, UNAIDS, unions, voluntary counseling, vulnerable groups, waste

project_abstract.cdata: This loan restructuring for the St. Kitts and Nevis HIV/AIDS prevention and control project would: restate the development objective of the project and revise the monitoring and evaluation framework; ii) simplify the project design by realigning project components; iii) update costs of project activities; introduce changes to the institutional arrangements to clarify roles and responsibilities of the implementing agencies involved in project execution and strengthen capacity for project implementation; and, extend the project closing date by one year to allow adequate time for completion of project activities. These changes will require amendments to the loan agreement.
